wikipedia_page.main:
Mark Andrew Feltham (born 26 June 1963 at St John's Wood, London) played first-class cricket for Surrey County Cricket Club and subsequently Middlesex County Cricket Club between 1983 and 1996.
An all-rounder, his right-arm medium-fast bowling was insufficiently penetrative for him to reach the highest level, as his career average of 31.64 for his 388 first-class wickets indicates. As a right-handed batsman, he scored 3199 runs at an average of 21.46, and managed only one century (101) in 197 innings.

response: Parker made a single List A one-day appearance for the Combined Universities cricket team in their first match of the 1989 Benson & Hedges Cup against Surrey at Fenner's. He was dismissed without scoring in the Combined Universities innings by Mark Feltham, while in Surrey's innings he bowled four wicketless overs which conceded 30 runs. He did not feature for the team in the remainder of the competition, with the Combined Universities progressing to the quarter-finals. He later played minor counties cricket for Suffolk in 1995 and 1996, making ten appearances in the Minor Counties Championship and a single appearance in the MCCA Knockout Trophy.
